Talk_008:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Sigh_00>Ah, hello, Link. <sp:5:1:0>This rain is troubling.
I hope it won't damage my documents.
Talk_014:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I think I'm going to continue my studies
of these inscriptions. <sp:5:0:0>My studies have
just begun.<sp:0:4:0>I never dreamed that our research into
that stone tablet at Lookout Landing
would take us this far.
Talk_015:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:TalkPositive_01>I'll keep researching ancient Hyrulean
so the whole world has access to the
thoughts of the ancient peoples!<sp:0:4:0>Thank you for all your cooperation, Link!
Talk_009:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Understand_00>When I discovered the stone tablet at
Lookout Landing, I could barely believe
my luck.<sp:0:4:0>I never dreamed I'd get a glimpse of a
window into the ancient past. <sp:5:1:0>This means
a lot to me, Link.
Talk_016:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Ease_01>It's magnificent... <sp:5:1:0>That stone tablet at
Lookout Landing set us on the road to
so many epic poems.<sp:0:4:0>I couldn't have done any of it without
you, Link.
Talk_017:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:LaughS_01>That's a depiction of the stone tablet
with the ancient Hyrulean on it. <sp:5:1:0>My
rendering of it is on this easel.<sp:0:4:0>Oh...<sp:5:0:0>or did you want to hear about its
contents again?<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Trouble_00>"Ones held y honore als hochmayde to
kyng Rauru ond quen Sonia, thaerafter to
his suster ond to princesse Zelda.<sp:0:4:0>"Her on thaes grete stan ond twelf mo
withalle make y endite min time with the
hyred roial.<sp:0:4:0>"So michte heore remembraunce
preserven for the sake of hem on whom
oure hope raeste."<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0100>It's short, but it's an introduction from
a servant to Rauru and Sonia, the
founding king and queen of Hyrule.<sp:0:4:0>She also waited on the king's elder sister,
Mineru, <sp:5:0:0>as well as someone named Zelda,
and wrote of their daily lives in 13 tablets.<sp:0:4:0>It couldn't be simpler!
Talk_001:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>It's the same Hyrulean script, and yet it's
so different from our modern language...<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0701>I still have a lot to learn. <sp:5:1:0>Hm?
Talk_018:
<sp:3:0:2:0700>I intend to more thoroughly research what
this chamberlain hoped to convey in these
ancient tablets.<sp:0:4:0>If you want to reread the inscriptions I've
deciphered so far, please come back to
see me.
Talk_002:
<sp:3:0:2:0300><snd:Trouble>I've been studying documents containing
ancient Hyrulean, discovered all over and
collected in Kakariko Village.<sp:0:4:0>But the text in these sources only appears
in bits and pieces, so my research is
going very slowly.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Angry_00>But I'm sure I'll someday have results
posted and ready for all to see at the lab
in Kakariko Village.
Talk_003:
<sp:3:0:2:0301><snd:Trouble>Our sources of ancient Hyrulean are few
and far between, so I haven't made much
progress in my studies.<sp:0:4:0>I'm sure I'll someday have results posted
and ready for all to see at the lab in
Kakariko Village.
Talk_004:
<clr:0500><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:QuestionNormal_00><clr:ffff>Don't tell me. <sp:5:1:0>Based on your stature,
physique, and distinctive right arm...<sp:5:0:0><sp:0:4:0>you must be Link. <sp:5:1:0>Am I right? Purah has
told me so much about you.<sp:0:4:0><clr:0500><sp:3:0:2:0701><clr:ffff>I'm Wortsworth. My research specialty
is ancient Hyrulean.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0501><snd:Trouble_00>And by ancient Hyrulean, I don't mean
the text found in the Ring Ruins, but
something different.<sp:0:4:0>It's what we call the language used at the
time of Hyrule's founding. Our modern
language is built on that foundation.<sp:0:4:0><sp:3:0:2:0000><snd:Think_00>These books here are written in that
ancient tongue. They'd look like gibberish
to your average Hyrulean.<sp:0:4:0>Are you curious about ancient Hyrulean?
I don't have anything to show you as
things stand now.<sp:0:4:0><snd:Angry_00>But I'm sure I'll someday have results
posted and ready for all to see at the lab
in Kakariko Village.
Talk_010:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Understand_00>It's odd to think back to the stone tablet
at Lookout Landing, knowing how far we'd
go from there.<sp:0:4:0>I couldn't have done any of it without
you, Link.
Talk_011:
<sp:3:0:2:0100><snd:Happy_00>No matter how often I see it, it's still a
magnificent sight. <sp:5:1:0>That stone tablet at
Lookout Landing touched all this off.<sp:0:4:0>I've deciphered so many engravings and
been treated to so many epic poems
since then.<sp:0:4:0>I couldn't have done any of it without
you, Link.
Talk_013:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Understand_00>This all began with the stone tablet we
found at Lookout Landing...
